topics.response: A derivative represents the rate of change of a function with respect to a variable. For a function f(x), the derivative f'(x) at a point x=a is the slope of the tangent line to the graph of f at that point.

An integral is a mathematical operation that represents the area under a curve or the accumulation of a quantity. The definite integral of f(x) from a to b gives the net area between the curve and the x-axis.

A limit describes the value a function approaches as the input approaches a certain point. For example, the limit of f(x) as x approaches a is L if f(x) gets arbitrarily close to L as x gets close to a.
